alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 8:22PM CDT until June 03 at 7:36AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Thu Fri 1am 1pm 1am Wakenda Creek Carrollton 16.0 16.2 Wed 8pm 16.3 15.1 12.5 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
